text: The Carlsberg Cup was a football competition played for two seasons between clubs in the Irish League in 1972-73 and 1973-74. Held at the beginning of each season, it consisted solely of twelve Irish League clubs in the first season, and in the second season it consisted of twelve Irish League Clubs and four B Division teams. ==Final results== {| class="wikitable" |- !Season !Date !Winner !Score !Runner-up !Venue |- align=center |1972–73 |16 August 1972 |Portadown |3 - 0 |Ards |Windsor Park, Belfast |- align=center |1973–74 |15 August 1973 |Crusaders |3 - 0 |Ards |Windsor Park, Belfast |} ==Sources== *Malcolm Brodie, "100 Years of Irish Football", Blackstaff Press, Belfast (1980) ==References== Category:Defunct association football cup competitions in Northern Ireland
title: Carlsberg Cup (Northern Ireland)
